com.yantra.api.inv

Interface getATP

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.INVApi, YIFApi

    public interface getATP

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document getATP(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The getATP API obtains an inventory picture for an item.

    • Method Detail

      • getATP

        org.w3c.dom.Document getATP(YFSEnvironment env,
                            org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                     throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                            java.rmi.RemoteException
        The getATP API obtains an inventory picture for an item. The inventory picture contains current inventory information and information about incoming inventory, based on purchase orders. The getATP API gets item details for the organization's inventory consolidator's catalog organization. The item details are returned as attributes of the Item element in the XML output.

        Availability of Model Items
        When inquiring for availability of a model item, the availability will be based on the availability of the items whom define their model parent to be the requested item. The model item's availability is the total availability of its children. The ItemFilter element can be passed to determine which model children items should be considered in availability. For example, specifying an ItemFilter with the ColorCode attribute specified will only consider those children's availability if the item matches the requested ColorCode.

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits:
        This API invokes the following user exits:

          com.yantra.ycm.japi.ue.YCMGetItemDetailsUE
          com.yantra.ycm.japi.ue.YCMGetItemListUE
          com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.INVGetExternalSupplyUE
          com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.INVGetSupplyCorrectionsUE
          com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.INVGetDemandCorrectionsUE

        Events Raised: None

        Audits: None

        Pre-conditions: None

        Post-conditions:
        The available inventory information across ship nodes is returned.

        Output Template Support: Partial. The ShipNode element is exposed. Some of the elements and attributes are not template driven. Refer to output xml for element level details.

        Database Extensibility Support: N/A

        Additional Information:
        API throws error if availability is maintained externally for primary enterprise code of inventory organization or ShipNode.
        Note that when determining which supplies are available, this API will not consider safety factors, and bundle parents will not consider children.

        Integration with Inventory Visibility (phase 2) enabled:
        Features not supported in IV- availability by tag, segment, items with variation, GTIN, VMI, time-sensitive breakdown, multi-brand won't be supported.
        User exits com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.INVGetExternalSupplyUE, com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.INVGetSupplyCorrectionsUE, com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.INVGetDemandCorrectionsUE won't be supported with IV integration.
        Instead of reading supplies and demands from IV, node availability api of IV shall be invoked and the availabilities at node/s will be modelled as supplies.
        In the api input xml, CalculateProjectedOnhandQty, ConsiderUnassignedDemand, ConsiderAllSegments, PeriodicalLength won't be supported.
        API output shall not provide all the detailed data. It shall not provide information of demands, onhand projected quantity, shortage, current supplies.

        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. Contains the criteria for which ATP information is required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

        Returns:
        For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.

        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
